alert.note: Alert for East Slopes of the Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued March 12 at 12:04PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...RISING RIVERS EARLY THIS WEEK DUE TO SEVERAL ROUNDS OF RAIN AND RISING SNOW LEVELS... For the east slopes of the Washington Cascades. A series of storm systems will bring mountain snow through Sunday, followed by rising snow levels and moderate rainfall Monday into Tuesday. The combination of accumulating mountain snow with subsequent snow level rises and rainfall potential, will yield increasing runoff. Moderate rains coupled with melting snow Monday into Tuesday will result in rises to area creeks, streams, and rivers. Some area rivers are expected to reach bankfull, cresting near flood stage Tuesday into Wednesday. While river flooding is not currently forecast, at lot will depend on how much mountain snow accumulates, and how much rain on snow occurs early this week. We will continue to monitor conditions and update this outlook as the situation evolves. For the latest river information and forecasts from the National Weather Service go to weather.gov/Pendleton.

area.areaDesc: East Slopes of the Washington Cascades
